poem:
**Pride Divide**

Within the echoes of London's streets,  
a parade misplaced under swelling skies;  
coins clatter like questions,  
dancing around a tarnished crown.  
Here, trust falters in borrowed boots,  
and rainbow threads unravel—  
yet somewhere, true steps stir  
on a path of honest hues.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
